result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry L. Lawrence II

records.addlTxt:
9:03 AM Defendant Larry L. Lawrence II in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Larry L. Lawrence II.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Attorney Gramstrup indicated that they are waiving the preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant. Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.  Waive reading of Information.  Plea of not guilty to the charges.
Status hearing scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on January 23, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Larry L. Lawrence II
Current: Taylor County Jail, Medford, WI 54451 United States  (Effective: 10-19-2022)
Prior: N2717 Stans Rd., Withee, WI 54498
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

1:13 PM Defendant Larry L. Lawrence II in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Larry L. Lawrence II.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Waived further reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived freely and voluntarily.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant must have no contact with S.K.T dob-9/22/1972 and the family of R. A.T dob-09/09/1960.

2:30 PM Defendant Larry L. Lawrence II appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Larry L. Lawrence II.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. State is requesting a modification to the bond to be increased to $50,000 cash bond with no contact with S.T and the family of R.T. Initial appearance still October 18 at 1:00p.m. Court orders a $40,000 cash bond no contact with S.T or family of R.T. Audio recording start at 2:32 p.m. and ending at 2:39 p.m.-JN

10:30 a.m. Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. State made many attempts to contact victim, but were unable to. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $4,000 cash bond with conditions of: reporting to the Taylor County Sheriff's Department for booking procedures. No contact with R.A.T. dob-09/09/1960 and S.K.T dob-09/22/1972. Court ordered $2,000 cash bond with the conditions of following through with the booking process, no contact with R.A. T. dob-09/09/1960 and S.K.T. dob-09/22/1972.  Initial appearance set for October 18, 2022 at 1:00p.m.
